artifact_name: textile; furnishing(i.e., household quality, not clothing)
Description: Fragment of coarse tapestry in undyed linen, read and dark blue wool and various natural (undyed) shaded of wool. Design consists of small lozenges or hexagons containing stylized motifs joined by bars to form a grid.
Curator's comments: Cartwright, C. R. 2017. Identification of fibres and hairs from two textiles from Wadi Sarga EA 72632 and EA 72553. British Museum SR Analytical Request No. 2016/34, British Museum, London. [Unpublished]. Soumak outlinking and style of motifs is reminiscentof Arab tiraz cloths suggesting a date later than the 6th-8th century dates typically assigned to Wadi Sarga [Information from Hero Granger-Taylor 1989].
